H0.text: Oxygen is the exhaled gas that is a waste product of respiration.

H1.text: Helium is the exhaled gas that is a waste product of respiration in people who inhale and exhale air when they breathe.

H2.text: Hydrogen is the exhaled gas that is a waste product of respiration when people take in and release gases from the air.

H3.text: Carbon dioxide is the exhaled gas that is a waste product of respiration when people breathe, taking in and releasing gases from the air.

A4.text: All aerobic organisms produce CO2 when they oxidize carbohydrates, fatty acids, and proteins.

A5.text: Carbon dioxide is a by-product of cellular respiration in organisms that obtain energy by breaking down sugars, fats and amino acids with oxygen as part of their metabolism.
